English:
*cough* *cough* a-HACK!!!
Wait! Wait, I beg you!
Chinese:
咳咳咳，咳咳咳咳，咳咳咳！！
等，等等！　等一下！
Korean:
쿨럭쿨럭, 크허억, 커헉!!
자, 잠깐 기다려! 기다려줘!
German:
*Hust* *Hust* *KEUCH*!!!
Wartet! Wartet, ich bitte euch!

English:
Some of the polluted air, it...it got in my lungs!
No for real, this isn't a tribute to my favorite
movie or anything...!
Chinese:
有一絲……污染的空氣……跑進去我的肺了！
不，這絕不是在向電影致敬……我說的是真的……！
Korean:
오염된 공기가…조금 폐에…폐에 들어갔다…!
아니, 이것도 결코 영화를 흉내내는 게 아냐…아니 진짜로…!
German:
Ich habe etwas von der ... verseuchten Luft
eingeatmet! Nein, im Ernst, ich imitiere nicht nur
meinen Lieblingsfilm oder so ...!

English: ...All right, time to drop the act.
Chinese: ……趕快停止這鬧劇。
Korean: ……촌극은 그 정도쯤 해둬
German: ... So, Schluss jetzt mit dem Theater.

English:
Got that right. Now why don't you go ahead and
spill the beans like a good boy?
Chinese: 沒錯啊沒錯，趁現在老實的說出來會比較好喔？
Korean: 맞아맞아 지금 솔직하게 말해주는 편이 좋다구?
German:
Aber hallo. Jetzt sei lieb und erzähl uns die
ganze Geschichte.

English:
I'd be quick about it, or our newbie here might go
hog-wild up in this place!
Chinese:
如果不說的話，我們家的那位新人，
可能會失控也說不定呢！
Korean:
그렇지 않으면 그쪽에 있는 우리 신입이 대난동을 부릴지도
모르니까 말야!
German:
An deiner Stelle würde ich mich beeilen, sonst
läuft unser Grünschnabel hier noch Amok!

English:
Don't let his dopey face fool you. When his switch
flips he's an animal! An ANIMAL, I tell you!
Chinese:
這傢伙雖然長這樣，
但是一旦生起氣來會很可怕的喔～？
Korean: 이 녀석, 이런 얼굴을 하고 있지만 열받으면 무섭다고~?
German:
Fall nicht auf seinen belämmerten Blick rein.
Der wird regelrecht zum TIER, sag ich dir!

English:
Just the other day some punk from another team got
up in his grill and he (beep)ed his (beep) right
in the (beep)...
Chinese:
畢竟他之前還對其他集團大打出手，
將對方的××拿去××
不僅如此還把××用力的插進去×××
Korean:
글쎄 얼마 전에도 다른 팀 상대로 대판 싸우고
상대의 ××를 ××하고
심지어 ××에서 ×××를 처넣고
German:
Neulich erst hat ihn so ein Trottel aus einem
anderen Team angemacht und er hat ihm den (piep)
so richtig ge(piep)t, voll in seine (piep) ...

English:
...with a dose of (beep) for funsies!
He's mad, I tell ya!
Chinese:
××然後再××××××××××××
都做到這地步了呢！
German:
... Mit einer Extraportion (piep) zum Spaß!
Der ist irre, absolut irre!

English: He, he (beep)ed his (beep)?! And even his (beep)?!
German: Der? Hat ihm den (piep) ver(piep)t?! Mit dem (piep)?!

English:
You savage! It's true what they say about the
quiet ones!
Chinese:
你，你這混蛋……明明長的一副人畜無害的臉，
竟然是這麼殘酷又變態的人渣！？！？
Korean:
네, 네놈……그런 인축무해한 얼굴을 하고
그런 귀축외도자식이었다니!?!?
German:
Du Barbar! Es stimmt also, was man über stille
Wasser sagt!

English: ...It's a bluff! Just go with it!
Chinese: ……是虛張聲勢啦，虛張聲勢！
Korean: …허세야 허세!
German: ... Wir bluffen! Mach einfach mit!

English:
Guys like him eat this stuff up with a spoon! Now
go on, look natural!
Chinese:
對付這類型的人，就是要用這種虛張聲勢的方法
最有效啦！好啦你現在就先在那裡，擺出一副
相當老神在在的表情！
Korean:
이런 녀석들에게는 이런 허세가 가장 잘 먹혀!
됐으니까 넌 거기서 관록있는 얼굴이나 하고 있어!
German:
Ach, Typen wie der glauben doch eh alles! 
Jetzt mach halt mal mit!

English:
...That's right. You better fess up.
If you don't, I...I might beep your...beep...
Chinese:
……就是這麼一回事。還不快點說，
如果不說的話，就把你嗶拿去嗶然後再嗶……
Korean:
……그런거지. 얼른 불어.
안그러면 삐―를 삐― 해서 삐―해버릴 거다…
German:
... Ganz genau. Spuck's lieber aus.
Pass besser auf, sonst benutz ich den (piep)...

English: Okay, I got it! I'll talk!
Chinese: 遵，遵命！　我什麼都願意說的！
Korean: 네, 네엡! 뭐든지 말하겠습니다!
German: Ja, schon verstanden! Ich rede ja schon!

English: Eeeeeeeep! Please, anything but the beep!
Chinese: 呃呃呃呃──！拜託除了消音以外！
Korean: 히이이이익―! 삐― 만은 제발 용서를―!
German: Aahhhhh! Bitte nicht den (piep)!

English:
Then you better get with the talky-talk, and I
mean toot sweet! And knock off that weird talk.
Chinese:
好，那就請你快快的說喲，
還有那奇怪的口頭禪也不准用！
快點說一說啊，快一點。
Korean:
그러면 팍팍 가르쳐 달라구.
하는 김에 그 이상한 말투도 금지. 평범하게 부탁해. 평범하게
German:
Dann mach den Mund auf, aber dalli!
Und hör auf mit dem Quatsch.

English:
Urk... Fine, I get it... We hackers gotta obey the
alpha hacker, after all...
Chinese:
嗚……沒辦法了……
遵從勝者才是駭客……
Korean:
큭……할 수 없지……
승자에게 따르는 것도 또한 해커……
German:
Ächz ... Na schön ... Schon verstanden ...
Wir Hacker müssen schließlich dem Alpha-Hacker
gehorchen ...

English:
...We send a signal on a certain bulletin board.
Then they'll tell us where the deal'll take place.
Chinese:
……你去指定的布告欄那，我們會從這裡發出信號，
這麼一來，對方就會指定出交易場所給我們。
Korean:
……지정한 게시판으로 이쪽에서 지시를 보내.
그렇게 하면 거래 장소를 저쪽에서 지정해주지
German:
... Wir schicken ein Signal an eine bestimmte
Anschlagtafel. Dann sagen sie uns, wo der Deal
stattfindet.

English: Call him out this second. Or else...
Chinese:
……還不快點叫那傢伙出來。立刻！
不然的話……
Korean:
……놈을 불러내. 지금 바로.
안 그러면…
German: Dann ruf ihn sofort an. Ansonsten ...

English: Eeeek! I get it, I get it!
Chinese: 好痛！　我知道了，我知道了啦！
Korean: 히익! 알았어, 알았다고!
German: Eieiei! Ist ja gut!

English:
We've got a deal coming up soon! You can meet him
if you go to the meeting place!
Chinese:
之後馬上就會有一場交易！
只要去交易場所就能見到他了！
Korean:
이제 곧 가까운 거래가 있어!
거래 장소로 가면 녀석을 만날 수 있을 거야!
German:
Es steht schon bald wieder ein Deal an! Ihr könnt
ihn sehen, wenn ihr zum Treffpunkt geht!

English: I'd call that a job well done!
Chinese: 算是解決了一件事啦！
Korean: 한 건 해결…이군!
German: Das nenne ich doch mal einen Erfolg.

English:
It's finally time for us to meet this "mastermind"
face-to-face. Chitose, you deal with the clean-up.
Chinese:
終於，要和「主使者」面對面了，
……千歲，就交給你收尾了。
Korean:
드디어「원흉」과의 대면이군.
…치토세, 뒷정리를 부탁해
German:
Endlich können wir diesen „Drahtzieher“ in Person
treffen. Chitose, kümmer dich um die
Nachbereitung.

English: All right! Just be careful, this guy is no slouch.
Chinese: 沒～問題！　小心一點喔，那人可是很有一套的。
Korean: 오케이! 조심해, 녀석은 수완가라고
German:
Gut! Aber Vorsicht, der Typ ist nicht zu
unterschätzen.

English:
...Chitose will stay here and negotiate with the
Steam Dealers.
Chinese: ……那傢伙留下來和「蒸氣領薪族」做交易。
Korean: …저 녀석은 남아서 스팀리맨과 교섭한다
German:
... Chitose bleibt hier und verhandelt mit den
Steam Dealers.

English:
We'll give them some other info or malware as
compensation for the useful intel. ...Think of it
as the cost of doing business.
Chinese:
在得到相對有利的情報後，會用其他的情報
或提供惡性軟體來回報……有點像是售後服務。
Korean:
유익한 정보를 제공한 대가를 다른 정보나 악성코드로 보답한다.
…애프터케어라는 거지
German:
Wir geben ihnen andere Informationen oder Malware
für die nützlichen Infos. Sind quasi ...
Betriebskosten.

English:
We take cases from a variety of teams. Yesterday's
foe is today's client, and all that.
Chinese:
我們會接到很多來自不同集團的委託，
也有可能昨天的敵人，今日就變成了委託人。
Korean:
우리들은 여러 팀으로부터 의뢰를 받아.
어제의 적이 오늘의 의뢰인이 되기도 해
German:
Wir nehmen Fälle von verschiedenen Teams an. Der
Gegner von gestern kann der Kunde von morgen sein.

English:
It's too easy to make enemies in our line of work.
Doing this is the best way to keep things civil.
Chinese:
每做完一份工作就結怨，那實在是吃不消。
用這種方式來使敵人減少也是一種做法。
Korean:
일을 할 때마다 원한을 샀다간 끝이 없어.
이런 수단으로 적을 줄여두는 것도 한 가지 방법이지
German:
In unserem Geschäft macht man sich zu leicht
Feinde. So sorgt man dafür, dass alles gemäßigt
bleibt.

English:
Chitose's good at this kind of thing. All sorts of
teams need info brokers, you see.
Chinese:
千歲對於這類型的服務很拿手。
也是因為這樣，才會在不同團隊中
都有情報提供者存在。
Korean:
치토세는 이 부분을 케어하는데 능숙하지.
여러 팀에 정보제공자가 있는 것도 그런 이유 때문이야
German:
Chitose kann so was gut. Teams brauchen einen
Zuständigen für Informationen, weißt du.

English: So why'd we have to fight, you ask?
Chinese: 你說這樣一來，為什麼還要特地戰鬥？
Korean: 그러면 왜 굳이 싸우냐고?
German: Warum wir also kämpfen mussten?

English: ...Well, that's easy.
Chinese: ……原因很簡單。
Korean: …간단한 얘기지
German: ... Nun, ganz einfach.

English:
It keeps things simple. Each side knows exactly
where they stand with this method.
Chinese:
因為相當「淺顯易懂」，
可以明確的表現出彼此的立場啊。
Korean:
"알기 쉽기" 때문이다.
서로의 입장을 분명히 해두는 데는 말이지
German:
So bleibt es unkompliziert. Beide Seiten wissen
so genau, was Sache ist.

English: EDEN's hackers aren't exactly a...logical bunch.
Chinese: EDEN的駭客啊……都不按常理出牌的。
Korean: EDEN의 해커라는 건……이치만으론 설명할 수 없는 거야
German:
Die Hacker von EDEN denken nicht unbedingt immer
logisch.
